Metadata: Improved cloud detection in GOES scenes over land

GOES data in the visible range have been used for quantitative environmental applications such as radiation studies, surface albedo mapping, cloud variability studies, studies of photosyntheticaâ€‹lly available radiation, and rainfall studies. But accurate cloud detection in satellite data over land is a difficult task complicated by spatially and temporally varying land surface reflectivities and emissivities. As reported here, the GOES split-and-merge clustering (GSMC) algorithm for cloud detection in GOES scenes over land provides a computationally efficient, scene specific way to circumvent these difficulties
